result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca Ann Kubica was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample if not already done. Court ordered defendant to pay DNA surcharge, and all costs, assessments and surcharges by 8/18/15, or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

With release to the Day Reporting Center. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence. Credit for 33 days time served.
Court advises the defendant may not possess a firearm and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rebecca Ann Kubica

defendant.name: Kubica, Rebecca Ann
defendant.address: 3722 East Oakwood Road, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.

Court advises the defendant may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample, and pay the DNA surcharge, if not previously done, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 12 months at the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with release to the Day Reporting Center. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring, and 33 days credit; pay all costs, assessments and surcharges by 8/18/2015, or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.

Defendant Rebecca Ann Kubica in court with attorney Frederick F. Klimetz.  Defendant Rebecca Ann Kubica in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant enters plea of GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant has $1,000.00 cash bail posted, must post an additional $1,000.00 cash for release.   Justice Point monitoring to convert to ENHANCED SUPERVISION upon release from custody.  Parties advised that effective 8-3-14, case will be reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17, in room 313 of the Safety Building.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-18-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Frederick F. Klimetz in court, defendant Rebecca Ann Kubica not in court, in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Daugherty).
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Defendant walked in and was taken into custody.  Bench warrant canceled; recall issued, copy to deputy.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Frederick F. Klimetz in court.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  FILE NOT  IN COURT.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Justice Point report addressed.  Defendant is not in compliance with conditions of bail.   Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Bail not forfeited at this time.  Case remains set for plea hearing on 7-21-14, 1:30 p.m.
Justice Point report addressed.  Defendant to report to Justice Point immediately following today's hearing.
Defendant Rebecca Ann Kubica in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Rebecca Ann Kubica in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  For reasons placed on the record, court allows one final scheduling conference.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

14RM023977  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05-01-14

Defendant Rebecca Ann Kubica in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Justice Point report addressed; defendant is not in compliance with conditions of bail.  Same conditions of bail upon release.  Scheduling conference held.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 06-06-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rebecca Ann Kubica in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Timothy Keller-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/10/14.

Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-14-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Rebecca Ann Kubica in court with attorney Frederick F. Klimetz.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties in court as to status of counsel.  State informs Court they need to subpoena witnesses for preliminary hearing.
Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE and adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Rebecca Ann Kubica in court.  Step Nolten for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense Counsel informs the Court that she is in the process of obtaining private counsel, attorney Klimetz.  Court grants the defendant a brief adjournment.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel in Branch PE.  Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/28/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Rebecca Ann Kubica in court with attorney Melissa J. Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Rebecca Ann Kubica in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
